docs.snippet: LOS ANGELES What does a studio do with an intelligent, lovingly crafted, critically praised $7 million motion picture that nobody wants to see? After "Bound for Glory" failed to attract audiences in its opening weeks, United Artists decided to put...
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES What does a studio do with an intelligent, lovingly crafted, critically praised $7 million motion picture that nobody wants to see? After "Bound for Glory" failed to attract audiences in its opening weeks, United Artists decided to put all its eggs into the basket of Academy Award nominations.
docs.abstract: Comment on United Artists' ad campaign for film, which has not done well at box office; sr vp Fred Goldberg comments; illus (M)

docs.snippet: Once again the top prizes in the Costa del Sol International Tournament went to the United States entrants, Larry Christiansen of Modesto, Calif., who took first with a 9-4 score, and myself, placing second with 8 -4 . This reversed last year's ou...
docs.lead_paragraph: Once again the top prizes in the Costa del Sol International Tournament went to the United States entrants, Larry Christiansen of Modesto, Calif., who took first with a 9-4 score, and myself, placing second with 8 -4 . This reversed last year's outcome, when Larry finished a half point behind me.

docs.lead_paragraph: JOHN VASSOS, whose book illustrations are the subject of an exhibition at the Silvermine Guild in Mew Canaan, is at 78 years of age a dynamo at irrepressible energy and an esthetic evangelist vigorously intent on bringing to the American public the message that art is one of our most important resources.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 26 In the sprawling railroad yards of this port city, crudely mimeographed leaflets are circulating hand to hand calling on workers to organize resistance groups against layoffs and changes in work schedules....
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 26 In the sprawling railroad yards of this port city, crudely mimeographed leaflets are circulating hand to hand calling on workers to organize resistance groups against layoffs and changes in work schedules.
docs.abstract: Left-wing revolutionaries are organizing labor resistance groups against mil Govt; mil intelligence services are aware of shift, and there is no reason to believe that security forces will be less ruthless in dealing with subversive labor agitators; underground labor movement, calling itself Gen Confederation of Labor in Resistence, says it has built up secret internal comms in many factories and public services with orders to stir up worker grievances; movement is led by Arturo Garin, Raul Barrionuevo and Oscar Chavez; labor situation discussed (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: BUSINESS is bustling at the second-hand clothes stores. Gretchen Ungemah whose Maizie Shop at 347 Central Avenue in Scarsdale has been in the nearly new trade for 38 years, has noticed the surge. "There's no question more and more women are doing it," she said.

docs.snippet: The National Orchestral Association, New York's training orchestra, is being guided this season under a succession of three conductors. Seymour Lipkin, the second of these, led a concert in Carnegie Hall on Tuesday night to bring his six-week sess...
docs.lead_paragraph: The National Orchestral Association, New York's training orchestra, is being guided this season under a succession of three conductors. Seymour Lipkin, the second of these, led a concert in Carnegie Hall on Tuesday night to bring his six-week session with the players to a close.
